nodes.text: Which computer component would you like to dismantle?

steps.action: Power off the computer and unplug all cables.
Open the computer case.
Unscrew the bracket securing the GPU to the case.
Press the PCIe slot release latch.
Gently pull the graphics card straight out of the PCIe slot.
Open the case and locate the RAM slots on the motherboard.
Push the side clips outward to release the RAM sticks.
Pull each RAM stick straight out of its slot.
Disconnect all power and data cables from the motherboard.
Remove all components (GPU, RAM, CPU cooler, SSD, etc.).
Unscrew the motherboard from the case standoffs.
Lift the motherboard out carefully without bending it.
Disconnect the CPU fan cable from the motherboard.
Unscrew or unlatch the CPU cooler depending on type (air or liquid).
Gently twist and lift the cooler off the CPU.
Lift the CPU socket retention lever.
Carefully lift the CPU straight out of the socket by its edges.
Place it in an antistatic container for protection.

nodes.text: Which type of SSD is installed?

steps.action: Unplug the SATA power and data cables.
Remove any mounting screws or brackets.
Slide the SSD out of its bay.
Unscrew the M.2 standoff.
Lift the SSD at an angle and slide it out of the slot.

nodes.text: Consult the motherboard or system manual to identify the SSD type and follow the relevant extraction steps carefully.

steps.action: Unplug the SATA power and data cables from the HDD.
Remove screws securing the HDD to its cage or bracket.
Slide the HDD out of the bay.
Locate the coin-cell battery on the motherboard.
Use a plastic tool or finger to gently pop it out of the socket.
Handle with care and recycle responsibly.
